text: William Leon Goldenberg (February 10, 1936 - August 3, 2020) was an American composer and songwriter. He was best known for his work on television and movies. He was born in New York City. He was known for composing the scores of Kojak, Rhoda and Play It Again, Sam. Goldenberg died on August 3, 2020 in New York City from heart failure at the age of 84.Billy Goldenberg, Emmy-Winning Composer and Songwriter, Dies at 84 ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American composers Category:American songwriters Category:Television composers Category:Writers from New York City
